Articles.Content:
Hello all ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

I know from doing a bit of hiking and exploring in our local woods, how usefull topo maps can be for deciding routes and campsites. Is there a mod for KSP that overlays topo info for the planets? It would be extremely useful for finding landing sites.![:huh:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_undecided.gif) I'm thinking some thing that overlays while orbiting said planet.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-01T00:10:03Z" title="06/01/2015 12:10  AM" data-short="9 yr">June 1, 2015</time> by GraviTykillz**
  
spelling

A topo overlay inside KSP would be nice, perhaps scansat (have not used) 

This external site shows elevations: [http://www.kerbalmaps.com/](http://www.kerbalmaps.com/)

> 
> Hello all ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
> I know from doing a bit of hiking and exploring in or local woods, how usefull topo maps can be for deciding routes and campsites. Is there a mod for KSP that overlays topo info for the planets? It would be extremely useful for finding landing sites.![:huh:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_undecided.gif) I'm thinking some thing that overlays while orbiting said planet.

If you want something ingame there's ScanSat, which is a mod where you can scan planets with satellites to see elevation, slope, biome, anomalies, and resources. It's also pretty fun.
